metadata.feature_description: Access and view files in a user's personal folder

test_scenarios.scenario_name: View Assets menu item visibility for admin

steps.action: Logged in as SuperUser (host) and navigated to Users panel
steps.expected: Users panel displays list of users
steps.actual: Users panel displayed with list of authorized users

steps.action: Clicked on more menu (three dots) icon for Regular TestUser
steps.expected: Dropdown menu appears with View Assets option
steps.actual: Dropdown menu appeared with View Assets option visible at position 2 in the menu

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Error notification for user without assets

steps.action: Clicked View Assets for Regular TestUser who has no files
steps.expected: Error notification should appear indicating user has no assets
steps.actual: Error notification appeared: 'Regular TestUser does not own any assets.' (confirmed via page state)

steps.action: Clicked View Assets for Claude TestUser who has no files
steps.expected: Error notification should appear indicating user has no assets
steps.actual: Error notification appeared: 'Claude TestUser does not own any assets.' (confirmed via page state, notification fades quickly)

issues: Error notification toast fades very quickly making screenshot capture challenging, but behavior was confirmed via page state inspection

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Open assets panel for user with files

steps.action: Searched for 'host' user (SuperUser Account) in Users panel
steps.expected: SuperUser Account should appear in search results
steps.actual: SuperUser Account appeared in search results

steps.action: Clicked more menu and selected View Assets for SuperUser Account
steps.expected: Evoq.Assets panel should open showing user's personal folder
steps.actual: Evoq.Assets panel opened with correct folder path (Users > 001 > 01 > 1) displaying multiple files including cavalier-logo.png, cavalier-tv.png, full-star.png, large_test_20mb.txt, product-image-2.png, product-image-3.png, test_document.pdf, and more

observations: Code review confirmed canViewAssets() returns true if user is admin OR has VIEW_ASSETS permission
The View Assets menu option appears at index 20 in the more menu dropdown for eligible users
onViewAssets() checks both userFolderId > 0 AND hasUserFiles before opening Assets panel
Error notification uses formatString with localization key 'err_NoUserFolder' to display user-friendly message
SuperUser accounts have fewer menu options (no Un-Authorize, Delete, Make Super User, Login As User) compared to regular users
The Assets panel correctly navigates to the user's folder structure (Users > [000] > [00] > [userId])
